properties.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 5:18PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED IN THE OREGON COASTAL RANGES AND THE
WASHINGTON AND OREGON CASCADES INTO THURSDAY...

.A strong area of low pressure off the Pacific Northwest coast
will spread moisture inland today. A cold front will slowly move
across the inland areas this evening and tonight. Relatively low
snow levels are expected to result in moderate snow accumulations
affecting much of Southwest Washington, the Columbia River Gorge,
and the hills above 1000 to 1500 feet around Northwest Oregon
through early Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. There is potential for freezing rain late
tonight and Thursday. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches.
Ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch.

* WHERE...Central Columbia River Gorge and Hood River Valley.

* WHEN...Through 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Snow and ice covered roads will make travel
difficult at times.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY
